text: Human B cells express <extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> receptors
Detailed knowledge regarding expression of different BMP receptors in B cells is currently not available .
To further elucidate the role of BMPs in human B cells , we performed western blot analysis for type I and type II BMP receptors .

This analysis revealed that the type I receptors <extra_id_0> Act-RIA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> BMP-RIB <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and the type II receptors <extra_id_0> BMP-RII <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> Act-RIIb <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> are expressed on resting human B-cells ( Figure 4 ) .

text: Taken together , these data show that normal human B cells and Ramos cells express a set of BMP receptors , previously shown to bind <extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> [ 16 ] .
